intro: Arrabidaea paniculata, commonly known as the yellow star cluster, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces legume pods that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
